perfusion.name: perfusion
perfusion.desc: The gold standard for assessment of PPG signal quality in industrial pulse oximeters. Defined as the ratio of the pulsatile (AC) part of the waveform to the static (DC) part of the waveform

skewness.name: skewness
skewness.desc: A statistical measure of the symmetry (or the lack of it) in the analysed signal

kurtosis.name: kurtosis
kurtosis.desc: A statistical measure of the analysed signal around mean compared to normal distribution

entropy.name: entropy
entropy.desc: Entropy: A statistical measure that quantifies the different between probability density functions of analysed signal and uniform distribution.

zero_crossing_rate.name: zero_crossing_rate
zero_crossing_rate.desc: A rate of how often the signal crosses the zero (switches between positive and negative value)

snr.name: snr
snr.desc: Signal-to-noise ratio: In this case, SNR is defined as the ratio between the analysed signal variance and its noise variance

msq.name: msq
msq.desc: Matching of multiple systolic wave detection or R peak algorithms: A measure of agreement between multiple different peak detection algorithms used on the analysed signal

relative_power.name: relative_power
relative_power.desc: Relative power: The ratio between power spectral density within the frequency band of interest (1-2.25Hz) and the whole signal (0-8Hz)

acf.name: acf
acf.desc: Auto-correlation based signal quality indices: Signal quality indices extracted from the correlogram computed by autcorrelation of the analysed signal

dtw.name: dtw
dtw.desc: Dynamic time warping: Compute correlation between a template signal and the analysed signal using dynamic type warping

lf_energy.name: lf_energy
lf_energy.desc: Low-frequency time marginal energy: Peak value in the low frequency band (0-0.5 Hz). High value of lf_energy indicates baseline drift or flat line (constant amplitude)

qrs_energy.name: qrs_energy
qrs_energy.desc: Peak value in the QRS frequency band (5-25 Hz). High value of qrs_energy indicates

hf_energy.name: hf_energy
hf_energy.desc: High frequency time marginal energy: Peak frequency in band over 100 Hz

vhf_energy.name: qrs_energy
vhf_energy.desc: Very high frequency band frequency marginal: Normalised median value in the frequency band above 150 Hz over 10s recording

qrs_amplitude.name: qrs_amplitude
qrs_amplitude.desc: Median value of the peak-to-nadir amplitude difference of the QRS complexes detected
